description: A popular mini-macaw, the Illiger's is predominantly green with a red forehead, and blue on the head and wings. They have a distinctive orange-red patch on their belly.
temperament: Highly intelligent, outgoing, and curious. They are known for their playful and affectionate nature, but they can also be mischievous and require consistent training.
loudness: Moderate to Loud. While not as loud as a large macaw, they have a high-pitched call that can be quite piercing and frequent.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Good talkers for their size. They can learn a variety of words and phrases and are known for their playful chatter.
dietaryNeeds: A balanced diet of pellets, fresh fruits, and vegetables. They enjoy nuts as treats, but these should be given in moderation.
healthPointers: Generally a hardy species with a lifespan of 40-50 years. They can be prone to feather plucking if they become bored, so a variety of enriching toys is essential.
housing: Needs a large cage for a mini-macaw, at least 30"W x 24"D x 48"H. Their noise level might be too much for some apartments.
